## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been playing around with multi-currency in Verus, but I want to make sure I'm aware of any limitations. What are some limitations of multi-currency in Verus that I should be aware of?

**AI Assistant:**
There are two main limitations to be aware of when working with multi-currency in Verus. Firstly, you cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. This can cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used, and is not supported for creating currencies. Secondly, in the GUI, if a currency is already supported in Verus Desktop, you will not be able to use that same named currency as a PBaaS chain.

**User:**
That's good to know, thanks. I'm still a bit curious about the first limitation, though. Why is it not recommended to create an ID with an i-address as its name?

**AI Assistant:**
It is not recommended to create an ID with an i-address as its name because it can cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used. This is because using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration.

**User:**
Okay, got it. I also had a question about Verus Desktop software. What's the current status of it, and what kind of warranty does it come with?

**AI Assistant:**
This software is currently experimental and unfinished. It comes with no warranty for any kind of damage, and users are advised to use it at their own risk.

**User:**
That's good to know. What are the terms of use for this software?

**AI Assistant:**
The software is free to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and sell, with no restrictions. However, the enclosed copyright notice and this permission notice must be included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.
What are some limitations of multi-currency in Verus that I should be aware of?

There are two main limitations to be aware of when working with multi-currency in Verus:

1. You cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. This can cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used, and is not supported for creating currencies.
2. In the GUI, if a currency is already supported in Verus Desktop, you will not be able to use that same named currency as a PBaaS chain.

#### Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.### DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. Use at your own risk! No warranty for any kind of damage!
